intro: Tirania purpurea, commonly known as the purple-tailed tanager, is a small passerine bird native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Thraupidae, which includes a wide variety of colorful neotropical birds. The bird is characterized by its striking plumage, with males displaying vibrant purple and blue feathers, while females have more subdued coloring. It inhabits cloud forests and montane regions, where it forages for fruits and insects. The species plays an important role in seed dispersal within its ecosystem.
